result.summary: All 19 integration tests PASSED. The active filter feature is fully implemented end-to-end: (1) Backend Pydantic models define active: bool = True with proper default, (2) ConfigManager correctly reads/writes ACTIVE field to JSON config, (3) Frontend TypeScript types match backend types, (4) UI components display active status badge and toggle functionality, (5) TaskForm includes active checkbox for create/edit operations, (6) Batch report execution filters out inactive tasks. TypeScript and Python syntax checks all pass.
testResults: TypeScript compilation check - PASS
Python syntax check - backend/models/task.py - PASS
Python syntax check - backend/core/config_manager.py - PASS
Python syntax check - fetch_reports_from_alma_analytics.py - PASS
Backend TaskBase model has active field - PASS
Frontend Task interface has active field - PASS
Frontend TaskCreate interface has active field - PASS
Frontend TaskUpdate interface has active field - PASS
Type consistency between frontend and backend - PASS
ConfigManager reads ACTIVE from JSON config - PASS
ConfigManager writes ACTIVE to JSON config - PASS
TaskCard displays active/inactive badge - PASS
TaskCard has toggle active button in menu - PASS
TasksPage handleToggleActive function - PASS
TaskForm includes active checkbox - PASS
TaskForm default active value - PASS
Batch download filters by active status - PASS
Inactive tasks excluded from batch runs - PASS
API routes support active field through Pydantic models - PASS
